title: Designers of Taliyah, ...
body:
...THANK YOU! She's so fun and strong! You did really great job! I enjoy every aspect of her, she's perfect!

(Now I only need a planty skin.)

Edit: STRONG - this deserves to be written in Caps Lock, she doesn't need buffs, honestly

replies.body: I just really wish the Worked Earth mechanic didn't exist.  I feel like she wouldn't even be broken without it... feels like I'm punishing myself everytime I use Q.

Because that would be toxic and unhealthy amounts of poke,with 45% CDR after your 5 rocks are thrown the Q is already up again 

Its a game health lever without it she wouldn't be broken/OP she'd just become frustrating as hell
But I feel that's still a healthy trade off for a non damage ult, a conditional damage and skillshot E, and a low damage, tricky skillshot like W. That's definitely a healthy tradeoff.

Her Q is her longest range tool and it would be without worked ground unhealthy
Her E and W are meant to be combo'ed for damage,Her W is like Ziggs W its meant to be for more for utility not damage,The worked ground mechanic is there let me say it again so she literally doesn't spam the shit out of it i don't think you read me when i said with 45% CDR the cooldown of her Q would already be finished by the time the last rock is shot
Yeah, plus the spell itself (if everything hit) has 1.2 AP scaling, combine it with E-W combo's scaling and HOLY SHIT
That would honestly be pretty broken. She can already shove in waves extremely fast and with her passive she roams very well, this would put her over the top in lane and teamfights.

its short range and can be blocked by minions. And the damage does less for each subsequent Q thrown. It's currently severely held back by the Worked Earth mechanic. You cannot tell me that Taliyah, who is a rather mediocre champion, needs this many restrictions whilst Yasuo, Zed, Ekko, and Azir have the kits that they do. 

Taliyah is the only champion who is ultimately punished for using abilities, and it feels terrible.

I honestly think Taliyah is pretty strong, and not mediocre. She has a lot of utility and shoves very quickly, the only thing keeping her from constantly instashoving every wave is her worked ground mechanic which I think is an interesting way to stop her from permashoving the lane and roaming with her passive.
Surfer Taliyah pls. c'mon her passive is already surfing and I'm sure there are many water-themed ways to change her other abilities

The thing is they know the wall is coming before she even gets there so their dash gets used before she can even use her W. So now she either is on the wrong side of the wall with enemy with only her E as "cc" to defend herself. Don't get me wrong though, I've played her and trapped people but 9/10 times people will just cross it with no problem before I get there. One memorable time is trapping a gragas and mundo, gragas flahed over and mundo...well mundo had a bad time. But the thing is I needed allies to kill them, like i said Taliyah does no damage unless she's constantly moving thanks to her shitty worked ground mechanic.

but does he come flying in from mid lane to do it?  My point was she has awesome map control compared to some popular mid picks atm.  Sure others have control but I think Taliyah may be the fastest at it without taking teleport.  Even though she can do that as well and be even faster at it.

Compared to most mid laners she's useless atm. If bot and top are doing there roles perfectly well (should be warding) and mid is calling mia's her global pressure diminishes significantly. compared to a tf, ziggs or an xerath, i would prefer any of those over her considering they have containment over other lanes.

> [{quoted}](name=AlÃ¼e,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O80As0gM,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-13T17:15:20.334+0000)

If bot and top are doing there roles perfectly well (should be warding) and mid is calling mia's her global pressure diminishes significantly. compared to a tf, ziggs or an xerath, i would prefer any of those over her considering they have containment over other lanes.

I still think she has a really good approach to teamfights that hasn't quite been seen yet.  TBH if the pros really learn her strengths they would murder a lane badly if someone stays in reserve on the safe side of the wall to catch a flash.  Can you imagine azir support or Allistar support that just sits back on the other side and just bumpers people back in all the time?  And with the support changes coming soon there may very well be a good option to anti vision (hopefully) to make stuff like that a thing.   I think she opens up a lot of team comps that weren't previously possible and people are just to scared to experiment.

I guess i should rephrase, its not that her damage isn't high enough, but that due to making any use of her abilities shes in pretty close proximity to any of the opposing champions. most of the midlaners excel in certain areas {{champion:101}} his range {{champion:238}} mobility {{champion:268}} zoning, she just can't perform against them imo. if they were to increase her range and or remove the worked ground effect she would be a solid mid laner.

I love her too.  I do still wish her W was a vector cast (like Viktor's E) even after reaching mastery 5 with two tokens for her.  There have just been a couple times where it really screwed me up.
For instance, I was stunned when I thought I did the first cast, so when I actually did the first cast (which I thought was the second cast), it was a world away from my enemy.  Now I know that that was my fault (should have realized I was stunned), but it does still annoy me every now and then.

Other than that though, she is fantastic.  Quite possibly my favorite champion in the game to play right now,
I personally like the cast how it is since it gives you some time to decide where you want to throw them.
